meanings.definition: Fail to meet the hopes or expectations of.
meanings.sent1: I always disappoint my mom when I forget to do my chores.
meanings.sent2: The team's loss in the final game disappoints their fans.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act disappoints the audience when he reappears too soon.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds disappoint the children waiting for a sunny day at the park.
meanings.sent5: The broken ice cream machine disappoints the customers on a hot summer day.

meanings.definition: Cause someone to feel sad or displeased because something expected did not happen.
meanings.sent1: Her absence disappoints her friends who were looking forward to seeing her.
meanings.sent2: The canceled concert disappoints the music lovers who had bought tickets.
meanings.sent3: The empty cookie jar disappoints the sneaky child who was hoping for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The closed amusement park disappoints the excited kids on a holiday.
meanings.sent5: The delayed train disappoints the commuters trying to get home on time.
